author: Shawn Graham

organization.description:
Open Archaeology. See the [Working Group on Open Data in Archaeology](http://wiki.okfn.org/wg/archaeology) for more details.

Please note that only open data should be added to this group. Data to enquiry may be tagged "archaeology".

### Metadata

See <http://wiki.osgeo.org/wiki/Location_in_CKAN> for the proposed metadata for both spatial and temporal dimensions. Basically, use meaningful tags.
organization.title: Open Archaeology
organization.name: archaeology

name: south-etruria-stamped-bricks
notes:
The original author is happy with dissemination of this dataset.

Some technical doubts:

* there isn't a single page describing the entire dataset, just a series of blog posts;
* the download link points to a blog post where you can download a *.doc* file which contains a related catalogue and the data tables - actually, I'm more comfortable with copy & paste from the blog posts where the same tables were published because it's easy to come up with a CSV file (the format I'd want for disseminating this kind of data, see for example <http://wiki.iosa.it/archaeometry:cluster_analysis>). Should we upload to archive.org a CSV version of this dataset?
title: Results of archaeometric analyses (XRD, XRF) of stamped Roman bricks from the South Etruria Survey, conserved at the British School at Rome
